There are three choices to fill the summer of an American full-time grad school student:

  • Work
  • More classes
  • Travel

I've always wanted to go backpacking through Europe, and I think it's something a lot of people dream of.

But Europe is really, really expensive. And so is grad school. So that wasn't an option

So where else can you go?

Certain countries offer Working Holiday visas. A working holiday visa let's its holder work in the country for up to a year. But it also expects that you'll spend the majority of your time travelling. You can read more about them here.

Australia and New Zealand offer these visas to Americans. Due to the favorable exchange rate, I chose to go to New Zealand.

But I stopped in Sydney, Australia first. And that's where I'm writing this from.

It was actually cheaper to fly to Sydney than to New Zealand by about 100 dollars, and I thought I should probably stop and see a bit of Australia while I'm down here. After all, the flight from San Francisco to Sydney took 15 hours, and that was only one leg of the journey.
